title: The Norfolke gentleman his last vvill and testament and how he committed the keeping of his children to his brother, who dealt most wicke ly [sic] by them: and how God plagued him for it. To the tune of Rogero.
notes: An edition of: The children in the wood: or, the Norfolk gentleman's last will and testament.
In two parts; woodcuts at head of each part.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library, Oxford.
